title: Parentinguistic: Parenting Supportive Message of Expressive Act in Parenting Perspective
excerpt: This study explores supportive parental messages and their meanings in parenting films. Using qualitative methods and speech act theory, it finds that each message serves distinct purposes shaped by the speaker’s background. Such “Parentinguistic” expressions strengthen solidarity and harmony in parent–child communication.

title: CHILDREN’S RESPONSE TO THE UTTERANCES OF THEIR PARENTS’ NEGATION: COMMUNITIES IN KARTASURA
excerpt: This study examines how Kartasura children respond to parents’ negative utterances. Most comply due to strong Javanese values of obedience, though some resist. The study highlights that parental negation is acceptable when used moderately
